edu.sjsu.yazdankhah.crypto.util.ciphersysdatatypes

Class DesSbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sjsu.yazdankhah.crypto.util.ciphersysdatatypes.DesSbox

  • public class DesSbox
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates S-Boxes like those used in DES.
    Author:
    ahmad

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • constructFromHexStr

        public static DesSbox constructFromHexStr(int row,
                                          int col,
                                          java.lang.String hexStr)
        Returns a lookupTable initialized with the given string of hex. The string might be formatted as underscore or space separated for readability. Every cell of the table is initialized with 2 hex digits. The size of the bare string should be row * col * 2, otherwise, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        hexStr - the given string of hex digits
        row - the number of rows
        col - the number of columns
        Returns:
        a new object of Sbox

      • lookup

        public BSR lookup(BSR sr6)
        Lookups the given value as a 6-bit ShiftReg and returns the result. This lookup is used in DES. The mechanism is of making the address is as follows. If the given ShiftReg is b0b1b2b3b4b5, then b0b5 will specify the row and b1b2b3b4 will specify the column. The output would be the content of the cell addressed by these (row, col).
        Parameters:
        sr6 - the given ShiftReg
        Returns:
        the looked up cell as a ShiftReg object

      • printHexStrFormatted

        public void printHexStrFormatted()
        Prints the content of this Sbox as a matrix of hex digits.

      • printHexStrFormatted

        public void printHexStrFormatted(java.lang.String debugMsg)
        Prints the content of this Sbox as a matrix of hex digits including a given message for debugging purpose.
        Parameters:
        debugMsg - the message for debugging purpose
